author: {'steamid': '76561198034985684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1527980616}
review:
Es wird nur eine kurze Empfehlung da ich sonst zu viel Spoilere

Das ist mal wieder einer dieser genialen kleinen aber feinen Indie Titel den man mal daddeln sollte zum ende hin auch emotionaler.


Es geht um Scarlett und ihre SchicksalsschlÃ¤ge mehr verrate ich nicht.


Aber es war groÃŸartig das man in kurzer Zeit durchgespielt hat hÃ¶chstens 2h mindestens 1h wenn man nur ohne viel zu machen den Spiel folgt.
Ich kam auf 4.5h da ich eine Zweite Runde anfing fÃ¼r die Errungenschaften.

Darum finde ich das das Spiel fÃ¼r den Preis doch etwas zu viel ist, aber Syncronsprecher mÃ¼ssen ja auch bezahlt werden die in Ã¼brigen auch sehr gut waren.
Dennoch das Geld war es wert ich wÃ¼nsche mir mehr solcher kleinen aber feinen Indie Titel.

Also kauft es euch im sale da kann man nix falsch machen.

Wer weitere solcher kleinen Indie Games kennt die wie Blackwood Crossing sind lasst es mich etwas weiter unten wissen^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197970714547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1525362567}
review:
Es gibt Geschichten, die sollte man nicht weitererzÃ¤hlen, sondern besser direkt erleben. So wie die von Blackwood Crossing. Man kÃ¶nnte das Spiel abfÃ¤llig als Walking Simulator beschreiben, da es im Prinzip kaum grosse oder abwechslungsreiche Spielmechaniken gibt und selbst der Umfang nicht Ã¼ppig ausfÃ¤llt.  

Blackwood Crossing stellt das Thema Loslassen und Erwachsen werden ins Zentrum und dies sehr stimmungsvoll, fast schon melancholisch. Der Titel lÃ¤sst einem wieder Kind sein, erinnert uns aber ebenso an die bittersÃ¼sse Traurigkeit des Ã„lterwerdens. An die Momente, in denen wir langsam erkennen, dass diese Welt und die RealitÃ¤t doch nicht so bunt, so fantastisch und so abenteuerlich anmutet wie wir uns das vielleicht vorgestellt, ja vielleicht auch gewÃ¼nscht haben.  

Die Geschichte rund um Scarlett und ihren kleinen Bruder berÃ¼hrt einem ohne grosse Theatralik oder SentimentalitÃ¤t, sondern besticht durch clevere Dialoge und die kleinen aber feinen Gesten, Symbolen und Momente, die sich dem Spieler nach und nach erschliessen. Ãœberaus gekonnt und zu Herzen gehend. Vielleicht eines der emotionalsten und tiefgrÃ¼ndigsten Titel, die ich jemals gespielt habe. 

Ich vertrete klar die Meinung, dass man den Preis eines Spiels nicht nach der LÃ¤nge des Titels bemessen sollte. Mir ist ein kurzes aber intensives Erlebnis lieber, welches mir noch lange in Erinnerung bleibt, statt ein aufgeblÃ¤htes Grind-Monster, dass meine Zeit verschwendet. Dennoch bin ich mir bewusst, dass 16.- EUR doch etwas teuer erscheinen, zumal man fÃ¼r den Titel knapp 3 Stunden haben dÃ¼rfte. Die RÃ¤tsel sind doch eher leicht und man kann das Spiel locker in einer Session beenden. FÃ¼r diejenigen, die den Preis (durchaus verstÃ¤ndlicherweise) kritisieren, sollten sich den Titel fÃ¼r einen SALE vormerken und auf die Wunschliste setzen, denn er ist es wert gespielt zu werden.

PS: Du magst Life is Strange? Greif zu!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995128738', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1523423685}
review:
It's a very pretty world that alternates between being dreamish and nightmarish, and the voice acting's very good.  The interface is a little sludgly, as it was hard sometimes to understand where I should be clicking and why my clicking wasn't doing anything.  Still, bravo for a three-hour sad-quest.  

(Jesus, why doesn't anyone make narrative games that make me want to drink?  Besides, like Tales from the Borderlands.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119381126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1590133212}
review:
The good thing: the story isn't that brilliant, but the way it's told it is amazing! I really loved the time I was able to experience and play this story.

The graphics are fitting and nice. 

But: its laggy and sometimes you feel like 'hm, did I move or is the movement just not accepted by the game? Let's try again aaaand walked to far.'


Story Spoiler!:


Why do such nice story-telling games always seem to end soo sad? :/ Still don't change the opinion that this is a nicely told story with fitting graphics!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082610824', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 613, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1494081379}
review: One of those hidden gems on steam, best played through in 1 sitting it's a fun emotional game exploring life and loss. I love finding games like this, they don't get much notice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980771676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1521671386}
review:

Ich bin mir gar nicht so recht sicher WAS ich von diesem Spiel erwartet habe, aber es war garantiert nicht diese Schlaftablette, die eigentlich als entspannt einschlummern lassendes HÃ¶rbuch besser dran gewesen wÃ¤re.

Ein Walking Simulator auf Eisenbahngleisen - was angesichts der Spielbeginnlocation noch nicht einmal ein absichtlicher Wortwitz ist. Man versucht mich auf eine emotionale Reise mitzunehmen, die mich nicht packt - die Figuren sind hÃ¶lzern animiert und transportieren die GefÃ¼hle suboptimal, die Geschichte ist wirr erzÃ¤hlt und das schnarchige Fortbewegungstempo inklusive der teils so ermÃ¼dend langweiligen RÃ¤tsel einfach nicht state of the art (am schlimmsten ist es dann im weitlÃ¤ufigeren Garten spÃ¤ter die passenden Unterhaltungen zusammenzuklicken - soooooooooooo langweilig).

Tut mir leid, wenn ich das Spiel doof finde, aber ich kann nicht anders - und es auch niemanden nicht mal im entferntesten ans Herz legen. Ich habe das Spiel vorab abgebrochen und fÃ¼hle mich seitdem wesentlich besser. Es ist wieder Zeit NÃ¼tzlicheres mit seiner Zeit anzufangen - und es beispielsweise in Spiele wie "flOwer", "Journey", "Unfinished Swan", "Abzu" oder weiÃŸ Gott was zu investieren, aber nicht in Blackwood Crossing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145406529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1520494954}
review:
Dear whoever just broke my heart,
 That was a beautiful game. I loved the story, the atmosphere was great, and the surroundings were beautiful. I think I cried a bit. Just a bit. Wasn't prepared for that. I went in blind (something I don't normally do with video games) and I'm happy I did. I highly recommend the game. It's a concept that anyone and everyone can relate to in some way or another and is very well designed. I also recommend going in blind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068566586', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1493345599}
review:
I played this game in one sitting, and even though at first it seemed creepy, by the ending the message became clear and the emotions seeped out. It's a fantastic game with a powerful message. I highly recommend this game.

Here's my playthroughs of it if you wanted to check it out.
https://youtu.be/zCkLFPmIobY

author: {'steamid': '76561198263450178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1519075050}
review:
[u][b]What's good about this game:[/b][/u]

Blackwood looks very good. The graphics aren't innovational in any way, but the game looks bright, smooth and generally pleasing, which is all you can possibly expect from a small game.

The game has an interesting concept. Even though, it's a walking-sim storytelling game the developers combined it with a problem-solving type of game. You progress through the story by solving puzzles around the world like putting things in order or make a dialogue out of characters' words. Nothing new to be honest but almost nobody does it for some reason although, I think it's a great idea.

The story itself in the game is very nice. The good thing about it is that it's not very generic and presented in a unique way. The story is also quite dramatic once you get into it.

[u][b]What's bad about this game:[/b][/u]

It's generally a pretty good balanced game. However, the only thing I think is a bit bad is its price. For people who don't care how much any game cost it's not a problem but for most people paying 16$ for a game that takes less than 5h is a bit too much.

Overall, I think it's a great game for anybody who is interested in quick, relaxing, storytelling game. I suggest you get this game when it's on sale though, even when the sale is minimal it greatly improves its price which becomes reasonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003462500', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1519079004}
review:
Almost more of an interactive drama than an actual game, but at the end of just over 2 hours I'm emotionally exhausted and satisfied with the experience I just went through. The voice acting really puts a lot into the game and the visuals are just lovely. The story outcome can be deduced fairly quickly, but the how and they who and the emotional journey is really what this game is about. Excuse me, I have to hug my family now...really tightly.

I may play this again to get the achievements as I think I missed a few pieces early on. I bought this game on sale for about $10, which is about how much a movie ticket costs. I might go up to $12 if I was buying this for another person, but probably not the full $16.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006445496', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1518996611}
review:
You ever start playing a gam and get fivbe minutes in, look at a character and go, "Your dead aren't you?" and even knowing from the beginning the story of how still gets to you? Thats this game. If you liked stories like Tacoma, Oxenfree, and Gone Home you will not be dissapointed. Excuse me, i need to go find who is making onions here and stop them. 

Good job PaperSeven

author: {'steamid': '76561198803421449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1518924373}
review: Thumbs way up for this game, but you need to like story-heavy games; in this one, the enticing narrative is the focal point. Rich graphics (take a moment to appreciate the full moon in this one, folks), and great voice acting (the British accent is always refreshing!) add to the experience. Some of the puzzles weren't intuitive (to me), which slowed down my game play, but I figured it out. I was on the hunt for an 'Edith Finch-type experience' and I'd say this falls into the same category. I don't think that's an easy category to be in! A head's up: this is a sombre tale. Whether or not you like it depends on if this is your type of genre or not - but I think it would be hard to argue that, regardless of your tastes, this game is beatifully rendered. And, it's COPY-EDITED. That alone is something to applaud. I recommend. Also wish I had a copy editor for Steam comments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060678884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1518814748}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993182723', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1517807719}
review: Playing a ~20 second scene and then getting a 10 second loading screen (on an SSD), over and over, is not very immersive..

author: {'steamid': '76561198089358986', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1517147288}
review:
This game takes you on a complete emotional journey. The story is beautifully told and allows you to relate completely to each character you meet in the game. No matter what I say, I can't feel I'm doing the game or the story justice. It's a game that will tug on your heartstrings until you're left in tears, I knew what was coming and despite that I wasn't prepared for such an emotional/heartwrenching ending. I never liked masks...but they're starting to grow on me now.

Play the game. It's worth every penny, I assure you of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975897155', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1517086124}
review:
[list][*]no customizable key bindings: WASD to move, mouse to look around and ARROW KEYS to switch between items. WOW. As if there weren't enough keys right next to WASD within reach
[*]abyssmal performance: fps drops from 144 to 60 all the time for no reason. i7 i8700k, GTX 1080
[*]mouse and controller sensitivity are way too high, even on the lowest setting
[*]mouse acceleration can't be switched off
[*]no adjustable FOV
[*]bad animations
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016999243', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1516050085}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992906798', 'num_games_owned': 13408, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1515986043}
review: This game made me cry like a baby at the end. While the game has technical issues, I do not regret playing this game one bit. Well worth the asking price and time (~2h) to go through this emotional ride of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972941429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1515344401}
review: Blackwood Crossing is a beautifully presented narrative game, with outstanding voice acting and some absolutely wonderful animation.  It's a short experience (2 hours), and about halfway through I was prepared to mark it as "not recommended" despite its' excellent presentation.  The gameplay is fairly minimal and clunky, and I thought I'd understood the story enough that I was getting a little tired with it.  I'm glad I pushed through though, as in the end it absolutely blew me away, and made the whole journey very much worthwhile.  Thoroughly recommended, definitely one for playing through in a single sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059424638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1515001387}
review:
Has a bit of technical issues for a game in which you mostly walk around with small interactions in between. However, the story is the main draw here and it does not disappoint. 

I like games that can elicit an emotional reaction from me and even though some of the flaws here are immediately apparent, I got what I wanted out of this and that's all I can really ask for. 

The art design is also really pretty if you're into that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142074347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1514479777}
review: Finn is a loveable character and the story is nice enough, but this game feels like a chore to play (as it has been mentioned in other reviews the pixel hunting is unbereable and the character moves too slowly). I've also found problems when using an xbox controller and had to solve some puzzles with the mouse and the keyboard instead. It's a pity, because it could have been an emotional experience even with the repetitive matchmaking gameplay, but the technical problems make really difficult to enjoy this game in its current form.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993364964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1514401434}
review:
I don't recommend this one for the opposite reasons I don't recommend Tacoma: While this one has good concepts and a good story, for me it falls short almost everywhere else: Even after patches, the game performance isn't good, moving around in the game feel awful: Never enough space, yet the movement is so slow. Even selecting things to interact with is unfun, as it's not always easy to tell what I can interact with, the hot areas are so tiny they reminded me of pixel hunting in early adventure games, and even when the cursor is in the right place, the animations that indicate which buttons I can push take just long enough to show up as to make it annoying. This leads to worse interactivity than we had in the late 80s and early 90s! Compared to, say, Life Is Strange, or the aforementioned Tacoma, the whole thing is a joke, and it's not as if this is a simple computer problem: I get 60fps, and the computer handles Assassin's Creed Origins without problems.

Then the puzzles are pretty iffy, and the music, barring the ending song, is under par for the genre, but that's minor given the strength of the premise.

I won't tell you that you shouldn't play this game at all: Everything I mentioned is patchable, and I sure hope that the developer spends some time fixing things, because as it is, the technical issues made it difficult for me to enjoy the overall experience, and I suspect I'm not the only one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255132675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1508117740}
review:
An adventure through life and death where dreams and reality walk hand in hand.

Blackwood Crossing is an amazing, story driven game about death and it's impact on the those it leaves behind.
This is more of an interactive narrative than a game, but still has some fun puzzles and scary moments.
Visually, it's stunning and stylized, and will grab you by the heart and not let go; the ending had me crying my eyes out.
There's a lot to spoil with this one, but it's a haunting, beautiful, and tear jerking ride that's well worth the journey. 

8/10 - A dream inside a memory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999103795', 'num_games_owned': 2231, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1508438769}
review:
Blackwood Crossing features a pleasant art style with interesting visual effects and strucure for presenting the narrative.  Unfortunately it is hindered by poor gameplay locomotion, mechanics and repetitive tedious sections that are unrewarding and time consuming because of core design and the clunky movement of the main character.  

Gameplay consists of searching for relevant objects or characters to interact with, often held up by dialoge in progress or about to occur which disables the ability to interact with an object.  Forcing a player to drudge through a story at a crawling speed feels like a way to milk the already low playtime for this game.  There are minimal animations in the game which felt more lazy than a design decision with the majority of characters frozen in place until interacted with to typically get some head rotations tossed in.  

How could it have been improved?
+ Add a job/running toggle for the characer. (I understand wanting to have slow story pacing, but if you add the option it lets the player decide how fast or slow they want to take in the world/story) 
+ Don't lock out items/objects because the character needs to do some small rant (rarely is this very useful in the scale of the story and gameplay)
+Add some idle animations vs leaving characters frozen and unanimated, I know it takes time and money but even if there were a handful of variants it would have done wonders for the production value of the game.  

Summary:
There are certainly better narrative games out there with more compelling stories and presentation of those stories, I wouldn't pick this title up unless it was about $5 and I wanted to solely appriciate the art style.  If they were to implement the changes I suggeted with faster movement and not locking out objects I would bet it shaves 20-30 minutes out of the short 2 hour playtime.  You do some tedious slow walking back and forth, back and forth over and over.

review:
I've just bought this and it took me like two hours till the ending.
it was nice, but not great. I like the graphics and voice acting.
but movement was not smooth and it makes me bit uneasy after two hours.
and Scarlett is way too slow and can't even run, it made me annoying since I like looking around here and there and I had to walk around to solve some puzzles.
and the sight was too narrow, I had to look down to see what item I was holding.

Annd story was,, welp bit felt like forced touching sad story.. And got me wondering so much.
[spoiler] There no clear explanation about how Finn or their parent died, did Finn died on the island's cave? did their parent commit sucide? who and what is rabbit boy. Was he just a metaphor of Finn's favorite rabbit rag doll? then why can't he go sailing with Finn? Finn did mention he died there. but does he really? and did Finn died in the Sea while attempting to Sail away? Why Scarlette refused to remember their parent's face? at first I though they abandon them, so they became orphans. Maybe I'm stupid or maybe Storytelling was BAD [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050294759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1523852487}
review: On February 3, 2015, I lost my little brother to an automobile accident. For years I've held the scars and regret that followed as have my family. He was 17 years old. A football star for his high school, German Honors Society, Beta Club, wrestling, and letters from colleges all over the US wanting him to check them out. He had so much, and then he was just gone. 2 and a half years feels like an eternity as sometimes I struggle to remember his face or his voice. Only photos keeping his image alive. This game had me in tears nearly all the way through till the tears felt like acid in my eyes. It was heart wrenching for me. When we were on the island, I begged in my head for me to take that lighter away from the tent so Scarlette wouldn't have to go through this, though she had anyway. There was no fixing what had been done. And I don't know how the mom or dad died, but regardless, this is a 5 star game. I'm never playing it again, but it was beautifully done from the art, to voicing, to the heart tearing moments. Only real criticism was that the cursor had trouble allowing you to interact with things at times. Other than that, perfection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179692597', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1507054696}
review:
I must admit I didn't expect much from Blackwood Crossing when I first heard about it. I thought back then it was another typical walking simulator when I first saw the trailer but really when I finished it two hours later I was an emotional wreck.

Story:

Blackwood Crossingâ€™s narrative is about the adventure of two siblings, one a happy, imaginative young boy named Finn and a young teenager named Scarlett. They were on a train when the game starts with Scarlett being annoyed by Finnâ€™s antics when something when wrong. People frozen wearing animal masks, the train carriages becoming gateways to different worlds and a mysterious black goo that chases the kids. It doesnâ€™t sound much to be emotionally invested in but seeing I am trying not to spoil the story, trust me it really does. There is seriously heavy topics and themes that are told more subtly rather than in Goneâ€™ Homeâ€™s case doesnâ€™t shove it in peopleâ€™s faces. What I really love this game is mostly Finn as he is one the best child characters I ever seen. Iâ€™ve seen so many terrible kid characters in media that are so annoying or acting like adults. What makes Finn so great that he is imaginative, playful as well as getting anger tantrums that is short and very understandable. Just like a real child. While Scarlett isnâ€™t as developed as Finn she is still likeable and you can see her side of the story just fine. Backed up by great voice acting, the narrative alone is worth the price. 

Gameplay:

Sadly, this is the weaker part of the game, Blackwood Crossing consist of the typical gameplay tropes of walking sims. First-person, point and click, dialogue choices and very slow walking. For the record, I have some mixed feeling about the walking sim sub-genre. I like Kona, Ethan Carter and Edith Finch but I despise, Dear Esther, the gameplay of Where is the rapture (not the story) and Gone Home is all right. But Blackwood have some puzzles while short and simple is rather well thought such as having to recreate a past conversation between two frozen characters which is unique. Dialogue choices exist but it is few and far between and often I feel it doesnâ€™t have an impact to the story.

Presentation:

Blackwood looks beautiful with its Pixar-escae character designs and the gorgeous environment which itâ€™s impressive, since it mostly set on a train. The music while not catchy, does add a ton to the atmosphere. The voice acting like I said before is amazing especially the actors for Finn and Scarlett which they sound authentic.

So basicallyâ€¦

I recommend this game and I hope the game sell well for the devs to create their next game to have this much quality and care into it just like Blackwood. For those who are hesitant but enjoyed other walking sims at least wait for a sale. For those who hate walking sims donâ€™t buy, youâ€™re going to hate the gameplay from the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995006448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1507026867}
review:

[h1]Story[/h1]
Es wird die Geschichte der Geschwisterwaisen Scarlett & Finn erzÃ¤hlt. Mehr mÃ¶chte ich aus SpoilergrÃ¼nden und aufgrund der kurzen Spielzeit auch gar nicht erwÃ¤hnen.


[h1]Gameplay & Steuerung[/h1]
Das Spiel bietet volle ControllerunterstÃ¼tzung, da wir aber immer aus First-Person-Sicht spielen, ist die Steuerung mit Maus & Tastatur etwas weniger fummelig als wie mit dem Controller. 

Blackwood Crossing ist ein interaktives Spielerlebnis Ã¤hnlich wie Firewatch oder The Vanishing of Ethan Carter. Allerdings in seiner farbenfrohen Darstellung durchaus etwas kindlicher, wenngleich es auch ein paar gruselige Elemente gibt. Ihr bewegt euch im aufgezwungenen Schritttempo wie bei Ã¤hnlichen â€Walking Simulatorenâ€œ, kÃ¶nnt ab und an bei sehr einfachen RÃ¤tseln mit der Umgebung interagieren oder euch von kleineren Zwischensequenzen begeistern lassen. Bildschirmtode gibt es keine, hier geht es einzig und alleine darum eine Geschichte zu erzÃ¤hlen. Davon abgesehen ist das Spiel komplett linear und ihr habt abseits des Hauptweges so gut wie keine ErkundungsmÃ¶glichkeiten.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1156419145

[h1]Grafik & Sound[/h1]
Die Grafik wirkt wie ein lebendinger Comic und je nach Ort auch mit schÃ¶nen Details. Bis vor kurzem hatte das Spiel auch noch einen lÃ¤stigen 30 FPS Lock welcher jetzt in den Grafikoptionen umgangen werden kann. Der Sound ist passend und stimmungsvoll, auch die Originalsprecher machen ihren Job sehr gut. Wer der englischen Sprache nicht mÃ¤chtig ist,  kann auf die deutschen Untertitel zurÃ¼ckgreifen. Eine deutsche Sprachausgabe gibt es nicht.


[h1]Umfang[/h1]
Ein Spieldurchlauf beschrÃ¤nkt sich auf 2-3h, viel mehr gibt die erzÃ¤hlte Gechichte auch nicht her, was aber nicht heiÃŸen soll, dass diese deswegen weniger gut wÃ¤re. Im Gegenteil, es handelt sich hier um eine herzzereiÃŸende Geschichte. Wiederspielwert ist aufgrund des linarean Verlaufs allerdings gleich 0.


[h1]Sonstiges[/h1]
Empfehlenswert fÃ¼r jeden der mit dieser Art von interaktiven Spielen etwas anfangen kann. Der Freude an Walking Simulatoren hat und sich gerne traurig, schÃ¶ne Geschichten erzÃ¤hlen lÃ¤sst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050261437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1506647863}
review:
A good, if not short, game.

The story unfolds in just the right pace so as to keep the attention of the player.

It lacks a FOV adjustability which was initially very distracting and left me with little desire to keep going, but it wore off after awhile and I hardly noticed by the back end of the story.

All in all, for a walking sim, this game was on par with most, but is no where close to being another Edith Finch.

Medical Warning: The ending made my eyeballs sweat. Not sure if they use hidden hypno-psychosis or something. My eyeballs sweated a lot at the end. Maybe hidden ninjas cutting onions.

For a walking sim under $20: 6/10. Meh, but like, "meh" in a pleasant way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971597949', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1505431723}
review:
Ironically, Blackwood Crossing tells a fantastic story by never really telling it. There are no heavily scripted moments of character introduction or stilted scenes that the player character is animated through. There are also no journal entries or second-person tutorials or other sources of concrete information. This is not a story told in the detailed recreation of past events but rather in the unsettling present shaped by them.

This brilliant choice, to hide the most basic details of the story from the player, slowly forces them into the same mindset as the main character. They become as puzzled and confused as Scarlett is, surrounded by the emotional fragments of tragedy. And when that mindset fully takes hold, every other element of the game takes on a heightened effect.

Blackwood Crossing shows the complexities of human nature. It portrays characters as human, each with their own set of expectations and flaws. The story is built upon these individuals and how they react both to tragic events and to each other.

Finn, the orphaned boy who canâ€™t remember his motherâ€™s face. Cam, the teenage boyfriend unsure of how to comfort in the face of overwhelming sorrow. Scarlett, the girl who feels as if her growing freedom comes at the cost of family. Every character in the game struggles with layered emotions and how to express (or hide) them when interacting with one another.

This creates a world in which characters wear an emotional and literal mask, each standing marooned in the multi-faceted landscape of Scarlettâ€™s memories. As the player encounters each character again and again, they slowly peel back layers of half-truths and false posturing to reveal an entangled web of emotional dependencies. When the characters are laid bare, itâ€™s impossible for the player to feel anything but overwhelming empathy.

Blackwood Crossing is at its finest when every element of storytelling comes to a fever-pitch climax. In that moment, the player understands that there will always be questions and that answers are both everywhere and absent. That what surrounds you is as important as what happens. And ultimately, that nobody is as simple as they seem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116928013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1512168429}
review:
It's been a long time that a game moved me to tears. Really nice work!

+Simple yet astonishing animation
+Great storyline, keeps you pinned to the screen
+Tricky but not too hard puzzles
+Great soundtrack

+- Short
+-Bittersweet story

-Sometimes when Finn looks up he looks nearly scary because you only see the whites in his eyes

author: {'steamid': '76561198029741420', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1504307437}
review:
This is a really tender story. It helps you experience some of the feelings a character is going through by using dream elements.
It's not exactly smooth in gameplay and the controls are a bit clunky so it requires patience. I'm looking forward to whatever the team behind this game may make after this, hopefully with tighter controls and stronger PC performance.
2 hours at most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023221061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1504299318}
review:
Altho patience is a virtue, it doesnt work the same way in gaming. For story telling/walking sim the walking part is soooooo sooooo slooooooooooow. The controls are well i guess they exist, but honestly it took me several tries to click on things i wanted to click on (and i do have over 20 years mouse operating experience). The puzzles, and im using the word puzzle liberally, are easy (if you disregards the walking part) so the playthrough is on the short side.

And im still gonna reccomend it cos the storys nice and not annoying
And you can give the sarcastic responses which is obv always a plus

author: {'steamid': '76561197965920199', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1502488595}
review:
What should have been an intriguing and charming adventure is frequently marred by poor design and development decisions. The field of view is ridiculously narrow, making it at best hard to explore your surroundings and at worst actually make you feel ill. The movement is incredibly janky, feeling like you're lurching from step to step instead of moving fluidly. 

The item and character interaction hitboxes are also horrificly done, requiring you to be at a specific distance and looking at a very small area on the item or character to do something. 

Some items in the game, despite staring right at them, can't be collected unless you ask Finn where they are. 

The game is locked at 30FPS, and feels like it's dropping most of them at any given time. It's not smooth in any sense. 

The developers are not responding to anyone in the discussions, instead sending what seems to be an intern to give canned responses.

I cannot recommend this game in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022312102', 'num_games_owned': 5431, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1501016783}
review:
Blackwood's Crossing story is heartbreaking and i find it really hard to explain without spoiling anything. All i will say is that it deals with loss, depression and overcoming your mourn of someone who's gone, as well as learning to find joy in remembering them without blaming yourself for what happened.
 If you enjoy story driven games this is a must play, but notice that it'll last for around 2hours so if you mind the price try to get it for cheap on other resellers or in steam sales because like that you can be sure that you wont feel like you paid too much for it.

  Eventhough it has a beautiful story i found the controls (with xbox wireless controller) to be a bit 'clunky' and 'stiff' but it's nothing that you wont get used to in first minutes. 

 Overall i'd give Blackwood Crossing a 8/10 for it's fantastic story, fully voice acted narrative and beautiful looks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986742635', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1500764640}
review:
First of all: the controls in this game are something straight out of hell. I have rarely experienced movement and interactions this incredibly unresponsive and inaccurate. Walking around feels sluggish and your inputs are often treated more like a general suggestion of movement than an actual command. When interacting, Scarlett usually takes what feels like an eternity to react to your inputs. If she reacts at all that is, because you might not have been looking at the exact right pixel when you pressed the interaction key. 

If you're still reading this, however, you might actually enjoy this game. The story itself is enough to keep you interested, though it's not especially complex or surprising. The atmosphere and storytelling are great though, with a few neat unique ideas. If you enjoy walking simulators you'll get a short but neat experience out of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968300492', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1500481626}
review:
Five Word Review: Short adventure game about loss.
Favorite Thing: The art style for the characters.
Least Favorite Thing: The movement feels very floaty and unresponsive.

Date Completed: 2017-07-19
Playtime: ~ 2h
Enjoyment: 6/10
Recommendation: It's a short and (mostly) enjoyable experience. Just don't expect to be blown away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065900209', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1500514041}
review:
It's not always I come across a game with a story that truly moves me, but here it is. Blackwood Crossing is a rather short adventure game with, I feel, a lot of love put into it.

The animations and voice acting, in particular, are top notch, as good or better than most triple A games I've seen, in my opinion. The soundtrack is also excellent  - the game even has its own "main theme" with a few of its notes being played here and there, and the original version of the song being played at the end. It all looks and feels very well done.

The gameplay is simple; most of the time you walk, talk to characters and inspect/interact with items. There are a few puzzles, but they're all very easy and quick; I don't expect anyone to have too much trouble with them. The gameplay is also linear and there's not much wandering around to be done at any point.

The themes the story touches upon are very powerful and to me the developers clearly dedicated themselves to making it all feel organic and relatable. It's really excellent writing, and one of my favorite stories of the past years. I also feel the length of the game, albeit short by today's standards, is actually just enough for it all to sink in while not leaving you burned out by the experience. 

I highly recommend this game to all people who are looking for a great, moving story with a lot of effort put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728166', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1500434896}
review:
[h1][url=store.steampowered.com/app/453310/Blackwood_Crossing/]Blackwood Crossing[/url] tells a particularly moving story about personal falloffs, grief and redemption, by fixing old memories and mending relationships at the edge of dreams and reality.[/h1]

Things turn surreal in no time as your character Scarlett goes looking for her playful younger brother Finn. The game is excellent at setting a unique mood that blends magic, weirdness and nostalgia.

It starts on a train you soon discover filled with strangely static characters who wear awesome paper animal masks. Listen to their short conversations and piece them together in the correct order to reconstitute an impression, and move on to the next scene.

The game is fully story-driven, with a few creative yet straightforward interactions. This is an original first person [i]point-and-pair[/i] adventure game, where most actions require matching two things or ideas together, not in the conventional sense.

It is not a challenging experience by any means and it is rather short, though it nevertheless feels just right in this context. Most puzzles are a breeze, except perhaps for the tree house password guesswork because you can't replay its audio clues, unlike everywhere else in the game. All other aspects are enjoyable, especially the developing relationships.

This simple emotional story is a nice change of pace from constantly saving the world. Its melancholy ending nearly had me in tears. If your inner child is still alive, this game is a must have in your collection, others may seek elsewhere.

[h1]Positive[/h1]
[list]
[*] Very likable characters
[*] Beautiful surreal environments evocative of dreams and child-like exploration
[*] Pleasantly simple and intimate story
[*] Innovative and unique gameplay mechanics
[*] Awesome soundtrack with perfectly cast actors, excellent effects and music
[*] Fun movie poster parodies
[/list]

[h1]Negative[/h1]
[list]
[*] Relatively frequent (though quick) loading interruptions
[*] Overly simple dialog choices don't add much value
[*] Slow walking speed, no running
[*] Choppy default video options (change Vsync option for smoother experience)
[*] Exaggerated head bobbing movement
[*] Targeting objects is a bit sensitive and needs precise proximity
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968668200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1499704285}
review:
Blackwood Crossing trifft zu 100% die emotionale Seite eines Menschen. Man erlebt und verarbeitet zusammen mit der Protagonistin die schrecklichen Ereignisse und versteht erst im Laufe des Spiels, worum es eigentlich geht. Definiv ein groÃŸartiger Titel, welcher eine groÃŸartige alternative zu so vielen Actiontiteln bietet.
Die CharaktÃ¤re sind liebevoll gestaltet, die Geschichte ist packend und mitreiÃŸend und der Stiel unverwechselbar gewÃ¤hlt. 

Eine kurze aber auch sehr kurzweilige Spielerfahrung die den Spieler definitiv zum nachgrÃ¼beln anregt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049807312', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1499595850}
review: A story of loss, heartbreak and an ending that had me gripped since the start of the game. Blackwood Crossing tells the story of Scarlet and her younger brother Finn who feels his sister isn't spending at much as she did in the past with him. Journey through an envirmoment of memories from their childhood and rekindle their bond.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138758885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1528297056}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013795140', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1499283030}
review:
This isn't the longest game, I completed a playthrough taking my time in 3 hours, then replayed it to grab a couple of achievements I missed which is the total playtime.

It always runs with vsync (or half) on, but on my system it ran happily at my 72fps. They have not fixed any FOV options however and initially this along with the headbob & weird swayey movement made me feel very off. Within about half an hour though I had got used to it and didn't notice it anymore. Other people however have had issues with it making them feel sick throughout, so worth keeping in mind if you are sensitive to it.

It's a gorgeous, simple little game - little more than a walking simulator, but that isn't a bad thing - it is a very good example of it done right. I can't say that I got emotional at all (which normally happens easily for me), but I felt satisfied by the conclusions of the game.

An easily 100%able sweet and beautiful game, though yes I agree that the full price listing is just too high, but worth grabbing in a sale if it seems like your sort of thing.

review:
Grafik: 9/10 Sound: 9/10 Story: 10/10

Traumhafte Geschichte um die Beziehung von Bruder und Schwester, die am Ende eine dramatische Wendung nimmt. Dabei wird der Spieler/in durch eine traumhafte Fantasiewelt geleitet die mit RÃ¤tseln und vielen liebevollen Details geschmÃ¼ckt wurde. Man mÃ¶chte einfach immer weiter spielen, den sehr guten Soundtrack geniesen. Die Steuerung ist minimal gehalten und kann zwischen Gamepad und Tastatur/Maus gewÃ¤hlt werden. Die Sprachausgabe ist englisch, die Untertitel in mehreren Sprache, darunter auch deutsch. Im Sale kostet das Game knapp 11 Euro und ist jeden Euro wert. Also zugreifen wer kann....

author: {'steamid': '76561198122946949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1499140016}
review:
First of all, I'm sure there are a lot of people who would object to even calling Blackwood Crossing a game. It is very much a walking simulator, and while it does have a few puzzles, the answers to them are damn near literally handed to you on a silver platter. If you're looking for a game with a ton of interactivity, or one that really requires you to think, this is probably not the game for you.
If however, you want an awesome story that you can get through in one sitting, definitely check this one out. I won't lie, I bawled like a baby.

My only complaint is the awful FOV and headbob. I spent the first 15 minutes of play time messing around in settings trying to make it bearable, and while ultimately there was a sweet spot where it wasn't a game-ending issue, it was still there. Also, the option for a speedier walk/jog would have been nice.

Overall though, this was a wonderful experience that I would absolutely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046696271', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1498599011}
review:

La patte graphique est trÃ¨s intÃ¨ressente et le doublage et la musique Ã  couper le souffle. Entre 1h et 1h30 pour finir le jeu donc une durÃ©e de vie assez courte mais le jeu sait quand s'arrÃªter ce qui permet de ne pas se lasser de cet univers. VoilÃ  les points positifs maintenants les points nÃ©gatifs : l'optimisation du jeu est assez moyenne beaucoup de drop de fps et les dÃ©placement du personnages sont lents. TrÃ¨s lent au point de perdre le rythme de l'histoire Ã  certain moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998056243', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1498507082}
review:
I thought this game had a great style, but while playing I found it a bit lacking. First of all, some technical (minor) problems:

- if you want to run the game in 21:9, you can, just put "-screen-height 1440 -screen-width 3440" in the launch options in the library, the game will be hor+
- FOV is really too low and can't change it. It is at headache limits.
- controls are not rebindable
- character walk speed in some sections is far too slow, and head bobbing too strong


That said, the game feels fresh but lacks in other aspects. Storytelling is nice, though the story is not only left to interpretation but also a bit simple. Design is ok but the graphical side doesn't let it shine. It is not a bad game but it is not a little gem that could have been (a "Pixar" style game would be awesome....both in graphics and story and meaning). It was moving but I didn't find the game very deep. Game mechanics are very simple which don't help the experience, but make it a bit more boring instead. More complicated puzzles or engaging activities would have been good to balance with the lack of depth in the story. Voice acting though is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044052777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1498435060}

author: {'steamid': '76561198364054303', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1498420443}
review:
Mir hat es Ã¼berhaupt nicht gefallen und ich bin sehr enttÃ¤uscht. Ich hab wirklich versucht es zu mÃ¶gen. Habe mir eine emotionale Story ala Life is Strange erhofft, was ich bekam waren 2 Stunden wirres Misch-Masch. 

Man kann sich am Ende zwar zusammen reimen was denn nun wirklich passiert ist, aber dennoch beantwortet das Spiel kaum Fragen nachdem es von Anfang bis Ende nichts anderes tut als Verwirrung zu stiften.

Und auch dieses Konzept mit den Masken hat mir Ã¼berhaupt nicht zugesagt.

Grafik: 8/10

Story: 4/10

Ich wÃ¼rde diesen Titel niemandem empfehlen. Aber eventuell ist es auch Geschmackssache.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095796103', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1498339906}
review:
Donnie Darko ; Enemy ; Eraserhead ; Enter The Void ; Fight Club ; Inception ; Martyrs ; Mulholland Drive ; Old Boy ; Only God Forgives ; Passion ; Shutter Island ; The Neon Demon ; Triangle ; Un Chien Andalou ; 2001, l'OdyssÃ©e de l'Espace. Tous ces films partagent la particularitÃ© d'Ãªtre "MindF_uck", comme on dit dans le langage populaire. Si l'univers vidÃ©oludique n'a pas pour habitude d'accueillir ce genre de caractÃ©ristiques, il en reste que certaines productions proposent des histoires Ã  faire changer une tÃªte en boule de billard... Je n'affectionne pas les quelques tentatives enregistrÃ©es Ã  l'instar d'Alan Wake ou BioShock Infinite qui, d'aprÃ¨s moi, emballent la platitude dans un coffret beautÃ© en acajou ; ce n'est pas en habillant Mr.Hankey d'une redingote verte qu'on en fait un EugÃ¨ne-FranÃ§ois Vidocq ! Qu'Ã  cela ne tienne, Blackwood Crossing est venu Ã  mon secours !



- 1 - Avant tout, sachez que la narration se concentre sur la famille Blackwood, plus prÃ©cisÃ©ment ses deux enfants frÃ¨re et soeur, Scarlett et Finn. Le joueur contrÃ´le la frangine aÃ®nÃ©e durant une aventure principale qui est au service d'une interaction constante avec la sphÃ¨re mÃ©morielle familiale. Le scÃ©nario s'articule au travers de plusieurs thÃ©matiques qui ont la particularitÃ© de concerner la plupart d'entre nous du fait qu'elles sont vraisemblables et se traduisent quotidiennement dans les habitudes qui juxtaposent le trouble personnel Ã  la satisfaction antÃ©rieure qui en est responsable ; la description d'une fatalitÃ©, ou l'imposssible conciliation entre le besoin rÃ©alisÃ© et les consÃ©quences qui en rÃ©sultent.

L'expression artistique se caractÃ©rise, entre autre, par un format mÃ©taphorique incarnant les souvenirs qui dÃ©chiffrent le passÃ©, ou le passÃ© supposÃ© dÃ©chiffrÃ© par un manque. Le conflit gÃ©nÃ©rationnel, la perte d'un proche aimÃ©, le sentiment d'abandon, autant de sujets pertients qui s'expriment par la plume du sentiment d'un enfant de huit ans. Cette substance onirique qui accompagne chaque Ã©vÃ©nement de ce voyage traduit la joie, la peur, l'amour ou la haine qui tourmentent le petit garÃ§on. Un rÃ©cit Ã©motionnel qui ne questionne pas tant la dÃ©finition d'un lien familial que la signification d'une connexion affective entre deux Ãªtres. Au fond, le fait que Scarlett et Finn soient unis par le sang n'a pas grand intÃ©rÃªt en comparaison du potentiel que reprÃ©sente une relation humaine susceptible d'engendrer des attentes diffÃ©rentes des deux cÃ´tÃ©s ; et lorsqu'une aspiration se trouve Ãªtre contrariÃ©e, c'est une immense frustration pour celui ou celle qui vivait dans l'espoir, ce faisant, c'est une recherche de la sÃ©rÃ©nitÃ© qui s'enclenche, une quÃªte pour apaiser la dÃ©tresse.

J'ignore s'il y a une concordance rationnelle, mais j'ai beaucoup pensÃ© au jeu A Bird Story. En dÃ©pit des nombreuses diffÃ©rences Ã©videntes qui sÃ©parent les deux oeuvres, j'ai le sentiment qu'elles ne sont pas suffisamment prÃ©cieuses pour rompre leur rapport consubstantiel. Les deux productions engendrent une poÃ¨sie de la naÃ¯vetÃ©. De sorte que Blackwood Crossing engage un rÃ©cit parcouru par une spontanÃ©itÃ© poÃ©tique fugace, certes, mais efficace. Tout est fait pour Ã©viter la complexitÃ© ; c'est un grand paradoxe Ã©tant donnÃ© que la fonction "MindF_uck" est bien prÃ©sente au sein mÃªme de la trame narrative. Pourtant, l'histoire est une succession de plaisirs hÃ©donistes saturÃ©s par la fantaisie d'un imaginaire actif. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=957677198

- 2 - C'est exclusivement destinÃ© aux utilisateurs qui recherchent une qualitÃ© narrative. Car le jeu est une premiÃ¨re tentative de dÃ©veloppeurs sans grande expÃ©rience, le soumettant ainsi Ã  de nombreux dÃ©fauts :


- > Un gameplay volontairement simple, ce qui le disqualifie d'une posture innovante. L'objectif Ã©tait de rendre l'expÃ©rience intuitive de maniÃ¨re immÃ©diate.

- > Des dÃ©cors pas toujours convaincants dans leur rÃ©utilisation qui traduisent un manque de moyen technique et budgÃ©taire flagrant. En mÃªme temps, le gÃ©nÃ©rique de fin prend quinze secondes Ã  recenser tous les participants au projet... Prudence sur la critique, donc.

- > La capacitÃ© de dÃ©placement est trÃ¨s proche de la mÃ©diocritÃ© la plus absolue ; j'ai l'impression de contrÃ´ler un tracteur-tondeuse John Deere ! La gÃªne est perceptible dÃ¨s lors que les Ã©nigmes impliquent de multiples allers-retours.



- 3 - Justement, de quelles Ã©nigmes parle-t-on ? Blackwood Crossing ponctue son aventure par des genres d'Ã©nigmes plutÃ´t originales qui sont loin d'Ãªtre superficielles puisqu'elles renseignent sur certains Ã©lÃ©ments narratifs. Ainsi le joueur doit entamer plusieurs dialogues avec des projections mÃ©morielles dans le bon ordre pour reconstituer la cohÃ©rence de cheminement. Ou bien devra-t-il retrouver quelques objets bien prÃ©cis pendant que le frangin s'amuse Ã  guider, "tu chauffes", "tu refroidis", "tu veux une Ã©charpe"... 



Je me rÃ©jouis de constater le rÃ©sultat d'un travail rÃ©alisÃ© par une poignÃ©e de passionnÃ©s qui engendrent une narration qualitativement bien plus aboutie que celle que portent de centaines de personnes issues de ces "beaux" et "grands" studios qui se dÃ©multiplient sur l'ensemble de la planÃ¨te. 

Blackwood Crossing est une expÃ©rience vraisemblable, dÃ©routante et harmonieuse . Un conte philosophique de grande qualitÃ© qui me rappelle que la vie est un rÃ©cit d'occasions manquÃ©es.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970312142', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1499025834}
review:
[h1]Review zu Blackwood Crossing  [/h1]

Blackwood Crossing war eine Erfahrung, die ich keinesfalls missen mÃ¶chte!

Das Spiel lebt vollkommen von seiner sehr emotionalen Geschichte und der tollen AtmosphÃ¤re. Spieler, die einem Spiel ohne spielerische Herausforderung nichts abgewinnen kÃ¶nnen, sollten einen Bogen um Blackwood Crossing machen. Es gibt nur sehr wenige Momente, in denen etwas wie Spielmechanik sichtbar wird. Im Grunde handelt es sich hier zu 90% um einen interaktiven Film.

Also ist das Spiel sicherlich nicht jedermanns Sache, doch wenn man offen fÃ¼r diese Erfahrung ist und auf Spielmechanik verzichten kann, sollte man sich Blackwood Crossing keinesfalls entgehen lassen. Denn was einem hier geboten wird, kann einen wirklich packen. Ich erlebte eine sehr intensive Erfahrung, allerdings sollte man sich bewusst machen, dass man das Spiel in ca. drei Stunden durch haben wird. Das mag manchem Spieler zu kurz sein, aber mich lieÃŸ die Story vollkommen befriedigt zurÃ¼ck; hier fehlte nichts und es fÃ¼hlt sich alles rund und stimmig an. FÃ¼r mich ist eine kurze Spielzeit absolut irrelevant, mir geht es ausschlieÃŸlich darum, wie gut mich ein Spiel unterhalten kann. Das Ende vom Spiel lÃ¤sst durchaus Spielraum fÃ¼r Interpretationen - was ich bei dieser Art Spiel sehr positiv finde, denn man kann noch darÃ¼ber nachdenken.

Bei solchen kleinen Perlen wir Blackwood Crossing merkt man, dass Spiele langsam erwachsen werden und das es weit mehr gibt als die Ã¼bliche Action in AAA-Titeln (die ich ja trotz allem auch gerne spiele).

Das Spiel wird stimmungsvoll prÃ¤sentiert und man merkt den Entwicklern die liebe zum Detail an. Grafik, stimmiger Sound und gute Sprecher (es gibt nur englische Sprachausgabe und deutsche Untertitel) tragen hervorragend zur AtmosphÃ¤re bei und ansonsten gibt es kaum technische MÃ¤ngel. Bugs oder dergleichen habe ich keine entdecken kÃ¶nnen. Die Steuerung wirkte manchmal etwas ruckelig und trotz stabilen 60fps wirkten die Bewegungen manchmal etwas zÃ¤h. Allgemein kÃ¶nnte das Bewegungstempo ein klein wenig schneller sein, aber das ist meckern auf hohem Niveau. Ich spiele derzeit auf folgendem System: Core i7-2600k @ 4,5 GHz, 12 GB RAM, Geforce GTX 1080 Ti @ 2 GHz (60fps in 4K und maximalen Einstellungen).


[b] Meine Wertung: [/b]
Grafik: 8/10
Sound: 10/10
Umfang: 2/10
AtmosphÃ¤re: 10/10

[b] SpielspaÃŸ: 86% [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1498007501}
review:
Ich hatte mir soviel Versprochen von Blackwood Crossing durch die Meinung einiger Journalisten und der guten Reviews. Das Spiel hat man in unter 2 Stunden durchgespielt und nach der ersten Stunde hat sich das Game leider fÃ¼r mich schon sehr hingezogen. 

Blackwood Crossing fÃ¤ngt erst gut an, aber leider kommt dann nicht mehr viel und wiederholt sich extrem schnell. 
Das Spiel wÃ¤re als VR-Erfahrung ganz nett geworden und hÃ¤tte die SchwÃ¤chen besser kaschieren kÃ¶nnen. Das Gameplay fand ich recht nervig, vor allem, weil es teilweise sich nach Hotspots abfummeln angefÃ¼hlt hat (mit Controller gespielt) und sich mehr nach Arbeit anfÃ¼hlte als nach SpaÃŸ.
Der Anfang wirkt wie der Auftakt wie eine Reise und man erhofft sich dann sovieles zu entdecken, doch dann wiederholen sich Locations.  
Das wird vor allem dadurch verdeutlicht, dass es keine Ãœberraschung bei der ErzÃ¤hlung an sich gibt. Nach FÃ¼nf Minuten hat man eine Erwartung vom Ende und man bekommt genau das. Man lÃ¤uft also noch durch die selben Locations, aber man erfÃ¤hrt an sich nichts neues, was interessant wÃ¤re, nur um dann das absehbare Ende prÃ¤sentiert zu bekommen.


Was am Ende bleibt ist eigentlich ein guter Ansatz, aber hier hat vielleicht das Geld und die Zeit gefehlt um ein bisschen mehr Abwechslung und Feinschliff in die ErzÃ¤hlung zu bringen. Positiv ist anzumerken, dass die musikalische Untermalung gelungen ist und die Sprecher ihren Job gut machen. Optisch ists auch soweit nett anzusehen bis die Wiederholungen kommen. Mir fÃ¤llt aber insgesamt kein Grund ein, weshalb ich jemanden gerade Blackwood Crossing empfehlen wÃ¼rde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015219621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1497909204}
review:
ErzÃ¤hlerisch ist Blackwood Crossing sicherlich eine kleine Perle. Es bringt menschliche Schicksale, Emotionen und Gedanken gekonnt auf den Bildschirm, ohne dabei in kitschige Gefilde abzudriften. Auch das Ende ist sehr gefÃ¼hlvoll gemacht. Obwohl nicht alle Fragen beantwortet werden ist es erzÃ¤hlerisch ein rundes Erlebnis. 

Spielerisch und technisch hat der Titel wenig zu bieten. Zu behÃ¤big muss man sich durch Blackwood Crossing bewegen. Die ohnehin sehr kurze Spielzeit wird somit noch kÃ¼nstlich verlÃ¤ngert. 
Die 15 Euro finde ich ein bisschen zu hoch angesetzt. Leider teilen diese Meinung wohl viel Spieler und deshalb hat man laut Steamspy, keine 4.000 Einheiten verkauft. Ich hoffe das Spiel kriegt eine zweite Luft in den Sales, weil unter 10 Euro kann man bedenkenlos zugreifen. 

7.5-10

author: {'steamid': '76561198065669373', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1496679824}
review:
[h1]Blackwood Crossing[/h1]

Language: [b]German[/b]

Blackwood Crossing, ein Spiel das vom Grafikstil her sehr interessant wirkte, und so meine Aufmerksamkeit erhielt.
Das Spiel hat eine kurze dennoch tiefe Story mitgebracht, die zugegeben einen auch direkt packen kann.

[b]Einleitung/Geschichte[/b]
Es handelt sich um ein Geschwisterpaar, bei welchem die Schwester Erwachsen wird und lieber ihren eigenen Interessen nachgeht wobei sie ihren Bruder vernachlÃ¤ssigt. Die Geschichte wird aus der sicht der groÃŸen Schwester, Scarlett, erzÃ¤hlt.
Diese wird als niemals endende Zugfahrt dargestellt, welche im laufe des Spiels immer dÃ¼sterer wird.

Pro's
[list]
[*]Sehr schÃ¶ne Grafik.
[*]Klasse musikalische Begleitung.
[*]TiefgrÃ¼ndige / Traurige Story
[/list]

Contra
[list]
[*]Kurze Story
[/list]

Kurze Story?
Ja, tÃ¤tsÃ¤chlich bin ich nicht nur durch das Spiel durchgeflogen, und habe mir auch gerne mal Zeit gelassen um die Umgebung zu betrachten, oder habe sogar bei ein paar RÃ¤tseln etwas lÃ¤nger gebraucht als eig. erwartet :D
Und dennoch habe ich das Spiel in [u]1.9 Stunden[/u] durchgespielt.
Schade wie ich finde.

Hinzu muss ich sagen das ( aus meinem eigenen empfinden ) die Handlung der Geschichte sehr schnell klar wird.
Ich bin nicht sonderlich der schlaue Bursche von nebenan, aber dennoch muss ich sagen das......
*SPOILER*
[spoiler].... das durch ein Kommentar vom GroÃŸvatter, sehr schnell klar wird, wohin die Reise einen fÃ¼hren wird.[/spoiler]

Aber das wÃ¼rde auch die kurze Zeit des Spieles erklÃ¤ren oder?
Schade das es doch so schnell zum " Punkt " kommt.
So hat es mir doch ein wenig den SpielspaÃŸ genommen, da ich wusste um [u]WAS[/u] es geht und [u]WOHIN[/u] es geht.

Aber trotz allem wÃ¼rde ich gerade Freunde dieses Spielegenres [b]Blackwood Crossing[/b] weiterempfehlen.

1.9Std. die mir dennoch gefallen haben :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014940948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1496425967}
review:
Quite a short game (2-3h depending on your exploration curiosity and achievements hunt), but the story/narrative is pretty great, full of both emotions and strangeness : a sort of mix between Donnie Darko, David Lynch and Alice in Wonderland.

Dialogs and cast interpretation add a nice touch of feelings to the characters, and even if you can start figuring out the outcome early on, still emotionnally touched in the end.

No gameplay per se (some puzzles and logic),  but I definitively don't regret having gone through the emotionnal ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063592333', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1492284976}
review:
Raised by their maternal grandparents, two siblings seem to share a bond beyond that of ordinary siblings but as Scarlett grows up, Finn is losing his playmate. First his parents, and now his beloved older sister. As the youngest of three children, I share Finn's pain. Despite there being just two years between me and my sister, I still remember trying - and failing - to get her to join me in my childish games. My fun, was no longer her fun. It might not be this memory that you share but Blackwood Crossing is based very much in real life, in having a loving family, in the gut-wrenching pain that comes along with that when loss occurs. If it isn't being left behind by your older sibling, it might be a different kind of loss but for many, PaperSeven will unstitch wounds that time has done it's best to heal. They've done a truly wonderful job in crafting a surreal and fantastical story that pulls on the old heartstrings.

While the story compelled me from the off, I found the controls to be somewhat lacking, a little clumsy, a little finicky. This doesn't help in the tight quarters of a train cabin. The interactivity of the game comes from prompts, press B to inspect, A to interact, Y to collect. The simplicity is perfect for the game but it also does demand that you look at the object that you want to interact with at just the right time, in just the right place. This provided a little bit of frustration early on. I'm rarely forgiving on such matters but Blackwood Crossing does everything else so well that after the first few minutes, it just didn't register. I know it was clumsy throughout but it didn't take away any enjoyment that I got from other parts of the game. A patch, of course, would only help.

Throughout the game you'll come across a handful of scenes, a train, a treehouse, an island. The staging is hands-down some of the best I've ever seen. Finn's energetic presence fills them wonderfully but look beyond him and you'll see a wonderfully detailed world full of interesting objects and lush visual clues that glue the entire scene together. Some of the many objects can be 'collected' to gain achievements and unlock more details about Finn and Scarlett's lives growing up.

The environments also seamlessly integrate with one another. PaperSeven have nailed that dreamlike state where climbing out of a train cabin straight in to a tree house (planetarium included) doesn't actually seem odd at all. Neither does the metaphorical 'evil' that lurks in their midst. Getting that combination of weird and wonderful right isn't easy but PaperSeven make it look so. It's the type of weird that Richard Kelly got so right on Donnie Darko, the influence of which can be felt throughout the game in numerous ways, the most obvious being a homage made by way of a fake movie poster slapped up on the wall of the tree house.

Blackwood Crossing provides it's challenge through puzzles spread throughout the game. It's often the case that puzzles in this type of indie game feel 'tacked on', out of place, or simply too repetitive. There's no such problem here, this is partly due to the game's short running time of around 2 hours but also because they are well executed. Not difficult enough to break the narrative but difficult enough to make you pause and think. The puzzles are simple affairs in which you may have just missed something, or in which you must get things in a specific order. The most common puzzle being a 'talking puzzle'. You get a room full of characters and you have to pair up their conversations by talking to them in the right order. It almost feels like a more evolved version of Snap.

Studio Head Alice Guy cites Sean Vanaman (The Walking Dead Season One, Firewatch) as "one of the heroes of our genre" so it's no surprise that Blackwood Crossing put me in the mind of Firewatch. It's a completely different game, a completely different story but the two share a similar ethos - narrative driven by compelling characters. The comparison is one I make for two reasons. The first gives you an idea of what to expect in terms of that narrative. Much like how the relationship between Henry and Delilah drove Firewatch, the same can be said for Scarlett and Finn in Blackwood Crossing. The second reason is rather more of a compliment. For understandable reasons (technical, time contraints, financial), this type of game can often feel like they have a little something missing - life. So called 'walking simulators' such as Dear Esther and Gone Home are wonderful examples of the genre but Firewatch, and now Blackwood Crossing, are raising the bar. They're setting a new example for small independent studios to reach and while that may be difficult for many to achieve, those higher standards can only be a good thing.

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[list]
    [*]Gorgeous, well designed environments with great attention to detail
    [*]Absorbing sibling relationship between Scarlett and Finn
    [*]Weird and wonderful
    [*]Superb, emotional narrative
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[list]
    [*]Clumsy controls
    [*]Slightly shorter than ideal running time
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Blackwood Crossing is a surreal and fantastical story very much grounded in reality, in love, in normal family life, in dealing with loss. It's clumsy controls and short running time can be completely forgiven based on it's gorgeous environments, superb characters, and terrific narrative. Blackwood Crossing is superb.

review:
Ein wirklich sehr schÃ¶nes, wenn auch beizeiten Ã¼beraus trauriges Spiel. Es stimmt zwar, dass sich einige RÃ¤tsel wiederholen, aber weder empfinde ich das als stÃ¶rend, noch ist das bei einem Storygame allzu wild.
Die AtmosphÃ¤re ist - sowohl durch die Grafik und die HintergrundgerÃ¤usche/Melodie, als auch durch die netten Dialoge ausgesprochen schÃ¶n.
Man fÃ¼hlt sich Ã¼beraus wohl, auch wenn das Spiel einem vielleicht nicht die Spielzeit schenkt, die man sich von dem Preis erhoffen wÃ¼rde.
Ich kann es nur weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037869676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1495813561}
review:
In terms of style i'd say blackwood crossing basically resembles other narrative novels, like life is strange.  So if you like that kind of style, I'm pretty sure this one's for you here.
 
Story- and character-wise I wholeheartedly enjoyed the game.  From the first second I felt close and connected to the characters , even though many things being left unsaid and unanswered during the story. Some might find the music too descent, I find that it fits the bill perfectly, always slightly supporting the overall mood of the situation.

Negative points might be that , sometimes, controls tend to feel a bit clumsy  and that the main story is indeed relatively short. But I rather fully enjoy 2 1/2 hours, than play a game for 20+ hours with half the time not 100% enjoying it. So for me personally these 15 bucks were very well spent.

review: Eine wunderschÃ¶ne Geschichte, die gleichzeitig so fÃ¼rchterlich traurig ist... :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198128522002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1603398674}
review:
Blackwood Crossing ist ein kurzweiliges Spiel, aber packend bis zur letzten Sekunde.
Wer StoryTellingGames mag und auf actionreiche Spielehandlungen verzichten kann,
liegt mit diesem Titel genau richtig. 
Hier geht es um etwas anderes. Es geht um eine pupertÃ¤re Schwester, die ihren ersten
Freund hat und um ihren kleinen Bruder, der die Zeit mit ihr vermisst und sich
die Zeit zurÃ¼ck wÃ¼nscht, wo beide noch mehr zusammen gemacht haben.
Und genau in dieser Geschichte der "Entfremdung" bewegen wir uns.
Die Geschichte, die StÃ¼ck fÃ¼r StÃ¼ck immer mehr Sinn ergibt ist sehr bewegend 
und beunruhigend zugleich. Irgendwie hinterfragt man sich am Ende des Spiels,
vorausgesetzt man fÃ¼hlt sich in das Game hinein, selbst, ob man nicht auch
schon Ã¤hnliches erlebt hat. Etwas ausgesprochen, was man gar nicht so meinte aber
nicht aufgelÃ¶st hat. Es erinnert einen daran, dass mehr miteinander gesprochen werden muss,
weil unausgesprochenes oft verletzender ist und Handlungen falsch interpretiert werden kÃ¶nnen. 

Um nicht zu spoilern schreiben ich lieber mal nicht mehr.

Nur eins noch. Spielt das Spiel oder passender, lasst euch fesseln und fÃ¼hlt das was auf euch zukommt.
Es lohnt sich!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042035466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1495704574}
review:
I kinda enjoyed with game, but it only took me 117 minutes for one playthrough and thats totally not enough for 15.99â‚¬.
It used to have its moments but I totally wouldn't recommend it for such a "high price". 
And I must say that I really didn't enjoy the controlls since some object are too big so you have to face many invisible borders which is pretty annoying. The FOV is also set too low in my opinion.
I read many reviews online and still don't get how people get over 3 hours in this game since I collected 80% of the archievments and it really didn't hook me up that I'd go for another playthrough.
